I'm so glad my generation and others like mine grew up in a time where every man over 30 was a war vet. Your grandfather, your dad,uncle,neighbor,teacher,coworker,etc. I've been around Vietnam vets,WW2 vets,Korean war vets,and even World War One vets. That's why people in and around my generation got careers and hobbies and never gave a thought to the military. Because we were always surrounded by older men who educated us or influenced us to never join the military. We'd seen how fucked up these men were. How hateful,aggressive,drunk,strung out,depressed,sad,confused,and disenfranchised these men were. We'd seen the PTSD. We'd seen how they were thrown away by our government,stripped of benefits,and forgotten. America forgets whole wars. My fathers 21 year old brother died in North Korea over 50 years ago never recovered. For what? For what?!
